channel.title: Distrelec Jira
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: New cache configuration added

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7938] Catalogue browse - Top navigation font should be smaller
item.description:
The font size of the top navigation should at least be smaller.

Background:
Previously this was used to show the categories or in other words show at one sight to the customer which products distrelec is selling. In that case the font size was ok. BUT as we are now showing there "services, configurators etc." this does not need to be presented as big as it is now.

My opinion:
This is the wrong place at all to advertise those services. I would pack these things into a button with an icon on the header bar as like this it is destroying all harmony and looks misplaced. What has the priority for our business? Do we sell services or products?
item.summary: Catalogue browse - Top navigation font should be smaller

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Hi Angel, please give your inputs, thanks.
Angel, if you approve to make at least the font smaller, it could be fixed until the rollout of cbrowse.
Angel already approved in a disucssion with me and Ruben applied the font changes in his local environment.
Please test

Could you please adjust this accordingly and check with Ruben Diaz Roman | Distrelec that it's fine FE-wise (incl. sticky header)?
Please hide the category selector as described. This has to go in todays Q deployment.
Please test

item.summary: I'm testing additional webshop tests (WEB // Catal...

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Hi Nabil, please have a look, thanks.

SOAP Request:

<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
	<soap:Body>
		<ns2:UpdateAddressRequest xmlns:ns2="http://www.distrelec.com/hybris">
			<salesOrganization>7670</salesOrganization>
			<customerId>0001253187</customerId>
			<address>
				<addressId>0001253187</addressId>
				<companyName1>reg.Company1</companyName1>
				<companyName2>reg.Company2</companyName2>
				<title>Mr.</title>
				<streetName>reg street</streetName>
				<streetNumber>6</streetNumber>
				<postalCode>86061</postalCode>
				<town>reg City</town>
				<country>FI</country>
				<phoneNumber>+358444444444</phoneNumber>
			</address>
		</ns2:UpdateAddressRequest>
	</soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

SOAP Response:

<SOAP:Envelope xmlns:SOAP="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
	<SOAP:Header/>
	<SOAP:Body>
		<SOAP:Fault>
			<faultcode>SOAP:Server</faultcode>
			<faultstring>Server Error</faultstring>
			<detail>
				<ns1:FaultMessage xmlns:ns1="http://www.distrelec.com/hybris">
					<faultId/>
					<faultName/>
					<faultText>SAP ERR:CMD_API,069 :Customer 1253187: Specify name of contact person</faultText>
				</ns1:FaultMessage>
			</detail>
		</SOAP:Fault>
	</SOAP:Body>
</SOAP:Envelope>

Hello Nabil,
It seems that something has been updated from your side and while you used to send the contact person details always in this interface now you don't send them.
This interface has not been changed for more than 1 year and I cannot believe that we have no issue in production. Please check there with a test customer.
From our side we will apply an additional check there in case the address details (name, surname) are empty not make any updates on the contact person level. Our check will be in Q soon.

Hi Evangelos,
We did not made any changes on this interface. The problem is coming from SAP side because it is not working even with soapui. I guess you tried also the same request with SAP and it was not working.

Hello Nabil,
As I said we applied a check here in case CP details are empty. As it seems is working now so please close this one or send it back for retesting.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7895] Direct order field

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7718] Datepicker issues
item.description:
It is not possible to select a date with the datepicker.

If the desired delivery date is entered via keyboard to the input field, then the correct value is transmitted.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Estimation needed(if possible) - This is part of the sprint. Thanks!

Hi Rafael,
You have a user to test please?
I tried to register but it's impossible:

ERROR: "Organizational ID number is not valid"

even if I introduce it correcly: 8 digits
Hi Ruben, please use one of those accounts: http://wiki.distrelec.com/display/distrelint/Test+Accounts

it needs deep investigation. The date-picker is basically doing whatever it wants :/
I would say 5h FE
Ok, please do so, thx.

All the future dates are not clickable because the BackEnd values minRequestedDeliveryDate and maxRequestedDeliveryDate are the same (see attachment)
The JSP affected is checkout-delivery-date.jsp

Neeraj Shandilya | Distrelec Can you have a look to the BE please?
Thanks
Akshay Agrawal | Cognizant :- Could you please take care of this. Thanks

Hi Ruben,

Dates are coming fine from Background code. This issue is coming from checkout-delivery-date.skin.checkout.js file. If we use shop language english then it's working fine but same will fail in other languages.
For reference, Please see the attachment.

Thanks,
Akshay

Hi Akshay,

I've discovered something. The dates values are different form Denmark-English and Denmark-Danish (see atachments)

These dates values are coming from the Backend. "minRequestedDeliveryDate" and "maxRequestedDeliveryDate".
Can you check why these date formats are different for the same country?

Get back to me for whatever you need.
Thanks
Dates must be always in this format: mm/dd/yy

Similiar problem found in Sweden:

Sweden EN: OK
Sweden SE: NOK

(see attachments)

Hi Ruben,

From Backend side we are sending you the date object. Using Format tag library and based on language we are setting the format date.
For ex.
<fmt:formatDate var="deliveryDate" value="$

{cartData.reqDeliveryDateHeaderLevel}" dateStyle="short" />

If you can change in that library then this issue can be resolved. Or we can apply pattern in the same tag through which we can solve this problem.
for ex.
<fmt:formatDate var="sDateMin" value="${minRequestedDeliveryDate}" dateStyle="short" pattern="MM/dd/yy"/>
<fmt:formatDate var="sDateMax" value="${maxRequestedDeliveryDate}" dateStyle="short" pattern="MM/dd/yy"/>
<fmt:formatDate var="deliveryDate" value="${cartData.reqDeliveryDateHeaderLevel}

" dateStyle="short" pattern="MM/dd/yy"/>

Thanks,
Akshay

Ok, I will force the correct pattern in the Front End.
However, we should also check why this format is wrong in the Back End.

Date and time notation in Sweden

In Sweden, the ISO 8601 standard is closely followed in most written Swedish. Dates are generally and officially written for example "2006-12-31", but the older forms "31/12 2006" or "31/12 -06" are frequently seen informally.

Date and time notation in Norway

Norway uses two date systems:
1 - D.MM.YYYY (e.g., 24.12.2006 for Christmas Eve, or 1.5.2006 for Labour Day) is by far the most common system, and is the one recommended by the Language Council of Norway. Dots are the most common separator, although you still see slash and hyphen (especially in handwriting): 24/12-2005.
2 - YYYY-MM-DD (the ISO 8601-standard) is used to some extent in official documents and in computer related materials.

Date and time notation in Finland

The all-numeric form for dates is in the order “day month year”, using a period as the separator. Example: “31.5.2002” or “31.5.02”. Years can be written with two or four digits, and numbers may be written with or without leading zero.

We will use this format for all shops: yyyy-mm-dd

(source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Date_and_time_notation_in_Sweden)

Applies as well to:

  • SE, DE, FI
Please test

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6768] NPS (Net Promoter Score) Implementation
item.description:
On the order confirmation page (thank you note) we Need to have 3 new elements:

  • One introduction title regarding "How likely are you to recommend us to a colleague?"
  • Radio button with values from 0-10 (the NPS)
  • One free text
  • NPS Type: "Order Confirmation" (constant hidden value in the order confirmation page)

The values need to be stored somewhere in the DB and retrievable (auto-Generation of a Report).
Generation of the "Feedback" report must be generated DAILY and sent to email addresses provided by ALE.

This Report should contain:

  • Input Date (Mandatory), i.e. YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
  • NPS Type (Mandatory) i.e. Order, Delivery Deprecated
  • Domain (Mandatory) i.e. www.distrelec.ch, www.distrelec.de,...
  • Order number (Mandatory)
  • Customer number
  • Customer Name (Mandatory)
  • Customer email
  • Company Name
  • NPS (Mandatory)
  • Free text comment

Suggestion: Develop the Generation of a Report over a timeframe (definable, first Suggestion is one week) and a cron-job which runs on a weekly Basis.

Note:

  • The Formular (NPS dropbox and Free Text Comment, hidden NPS Type) needs to be reusable on a CMS/Merchandizing page. The Merchandizing page will have an other hidden NPS Type (e.g. "Delivery Confirmation"), that will require to retrieve additional variables from http request
  • This Report will feed Qlikview to create proper reporting (Definition still required).
  • For now Export always each ones in a flatfile (csv), ";" separator

If clarity in specification are required, come by to David.

Variables that come with the url:
https://www.distrelec.de/de/cms/nps?salesorg=7350&contactnum=326411&order=003UUL0A&cnumber=1202553&fname=Armin&namn=Freaking&email=zilling%40most-mobile.net&lang=de&company=MOST%20Mobile%20Specials%20GmbH&delivery=20150622

The url parameters should be passed (could happen that not all urls come with all parameters complete or even some missing)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please estimate

Hi David,

should we store also the customer information or it is anonymous? What should we store in addition to the informations above ? (order number, customer number, customer name, customer email, etc.)

Hi Nabil,

Yes, at least those informations need to be in a retrievable report:
order number, customer number, customer name, customer email, company Name, NPS, and the free text comment

In that sence those informations need to be stored to be able to retrieve all the others: order number, NPS, free text comment

The introduction title will be:
"How likely are you to recommend us to a colleague?"

Hi David,

what are the different NPS types? Could you make a list please? Thx

/Nabil.

At the Moment only two NPS types: "Order Confirmation", Delivery Confirmation"

The constant "Order Confirmation" will be written as NPS type every time that the customer gives a Rating on the thank you page (order confirmation page)
Among these fields, which ones are mandatory and which are not?
What is the format of the export file ? Should I export each time all records or only the non-exported ones ?
See in the description the mantatory filed and Format (csv, ";")
Is there any pre-defined order of the fields ?

Hi,
the NPS BE functionality, including the export cron job, is implemented. Please assign it to FE developer for the FE part.

/Nabil.

Hello Erik,

could you please take care of the FE part of this ticket?
Because I will be on holiday till Tue 26.05

Thanks,
Ruben

@Nabil: Could you please Change the Export to add the "Input Date" and the "Domain" (distrelec.ch, distrelec.de,...). Export each week Input Date > Monday current week and Input Date <= Sunday current week.

thx
The new fields has been added.
Should NOT be in the P-Deployment of sprint 11. Should earliest go live with sprint 2015-06.

Optivo will push the dynamic values on the url of our NPS final page. It would look something like this:

http://www.distrelec.de/de/cms/nps?order=003UUL0A&cnumber=1386864&fname=Andreas&Namn=Petterson&email=andreaserikpettersson@yahoo.se

will it work? you need to take all this values as hidden and attach them to the form submit.

Hi Angel,

Please use "https" instead of "http" because of private data in the URL.

Hi Angel Munoz | Distrelec
Yes, we can read these parameters from the URL

Hi Nabil, Actually Optivo also suggests MD5 encoding.

Just asked Ruben and David, but maybe you can tell me.

Hi Angel,

MD5 encoding is not reversible, i.e., from MD5 hash we cannot get the original text. However, we can use other encryption algorithms, such as AES, which are reversible. These algorithms uses a secret key to encrypt/decrypt text.

AES: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advanced_Encryption_Standard
Will let this guys know. Thanks Nabil!!
Please add remaining estimate, thx.

This ticket is around 70-80% done.
We just need this URL encoding.
Waiting for Angel response

Hello Angel,

we need to know more about this encoding. You have any news?
And also an example of URL, or specification, to see how this URL will be (exact name of each parameter, etc)

Thanks
according to Andrea we do not implement this anymore. I will close the ticket and it can be re-open anytime.

URGENT!!
„each day“ a report (excel file) would be created with all the customer details and qualitative feedback that will then be sent to dedicated email addresses in each country

  1. What kind of encoding is used on the links from optivo?
  2. To which email addresses should the report be sent?
    and:

1. Encoding used is Base64.

$!{null}#if("$Unable to render embedded object: File (user.data.email" != "")$) not found.{null}${bmMisc.encodeBase64($!user.data.email)}$!{null}#end$!{null}

I recommend using the url without encoding, at least in the first implementation.

2. Email addresses will be provided tomorrow.

(same naming will apply to all countries and languages)

{Order Number}&cnumber={Customer Number}&fname={Firstname}&namn={Lastname}&email={Email}&lang={Language}&company={Company Name}&delivery={Parcel Date}

Please don’t get me wrong, I don’t want to pick-up a fight but we cannot continue delivering our commitments with such a delay.

NPS (mandatory) was part of initial specification (clarified on the meeting we had) and tittle…, well this one I admit it was blurry (though some logic applies, email without proper subject…).

As of the comment deletion, please don’t. I will try to be less wedgy on my comments and I respect your work and I know you are low on resources.

If you delete any of my comments we will then have a very different type of relationship.
Please test after deployment of v3.6.0.
Super, will do Nabil. Thanks!
NPS is supposed to be done with radio buttons (values left to right) from 0-10 display list is not the right format.
When can we expect the resolution of the radio buttons (both hybris and non-hybris)?

Hi Angel Munoz | Distrelec,
to estimate the FE effort, I will first need the design you want for it.
Thanks

Hi Ruben,

The radio button just shouldn't have any default value already selected and selecting the score is mandatory. Number above the Radio button. Do you need more Infos?
Please check subtask 4. It includes a couple of images that show how it should look like. Remember it is Hybris and Non-hybris.
